short: Automatically focus the first candidate in omnibar results
description: Controls whether the first search result in the omnibar should be automatically focused when results are displayed. When enabled, the first candidate in omnibar search results (bookmarks, open tabs, VI marks, user URLs, etc.) will have visual focus applied, making it ready for selection with Enter. Individual omnibar handlers can override this setting with their own focusFirstCandidate property.
valueDescription: true to automatically focus the first candidate in omnibar results; false to not focus any result by default

notes: This is a global runtime configuration setting that serves as a fallback default for omnibar result focusing behavior. Individual omnibar handlers (AddBookmark, OpenTabs, OpenVIMarks, Commands, OpenUserURLs) can override this setting with their own focusFirstCandidate property. The decision to focus is made when results are displayed using a logical OR: if either the global setting OR the handler-specific setting is true, the first result gets focus. This allows granular control per handler while providing a global default.
